thread.section_title: Travel News & Deals - Los Angeles Times
thread.title: Your chance to chill at the Colorado River Regatta in Bullhead City, Ariz.
thread.title_full: Your chance to chill at the Colorado River Regatta in Bullhead City, Ariz.

author: Jay Jones
title: Your chance to chill at the Colorado River Regatta in Bullhead City, Ariz.
text:
Your chance to chill at the Colorado River Regatta in Bullhead City, Ariz. Colorado River Regatta Brian Jones / Las Vegas News Bureau 
Groups of up to 10 "watercraft" can be tied together for a leisurely float down the Colorado River during the regatta, which will be Aug. 8. 
Groups of up to 10 "watercraft" can be tied together for a leisurely float down the Colorado River during the regatta, which will be Aug. 8. (Brian Jones / Las Vegas News Bureau) By Jay Jones 
Despite the brutal summer heat, thousands of people will converge on Laughlin, Nev., in early August to chill – not in an air-conditioned casino but on the Colorado River. 
The Aug. 8 River Regatta , one of the region’s biggest annual events, will welcome water lovers to a leisurely nine-mile, four-hour float. Colorado River Regatta Brian Jones/Las Vegas News Bureau 
The resorts of Laughlin, Nev., form the backdrop for the Colorado River Regatta. The annual float will be Aug. 8. 

The resorts of Laughlin, Nev., form the backdrop for the Colorado River Regatta. The annual float will be Aug. 8. 
(Brian Jones/Las Vegas News Bureau) 
Most of the year, jet skis and speedboats are common sights on the river, but the regatta is open to non-motorized watercraft such as floats, inner tubes and kayaks. Some people even build barges for the event. 
Participants can launch between 7 a.m. and 1 p.m. from one of two locations in Bullhead City, Ariz., directly across the river from the casino enclave of Laughlin . 
Friends often travel downriver in a group by lashing their tubes together. The regatta rules allow for as many as 10 tubes to be joined as one.
